title: 5 Easy Ways to Save and Download a PDF File

steps.title: Navigate to the PDF that you want to save in your web browser.
steps.content: Navigate to the PDF that you want to save in your web browser. You can do this with any web browser on your computer, laptop, phone, or tablet. You may not be able to save the PDF if the original author put limitations on it or restricted downloads. In that case, you need to get in contact with the original author to get access to that PDF.

steps.title: Click the Save file icon.
steps.content: Click the Save file icon. This can look like a floppy disk or an arrow pointing down (like the Download icon). The file will either be downloaded instantly to your browser or you'll be prompted to select a location where to save the PDF. The Save file icon may not be visible until you move your cursor on your screen. It'll be either in the top center of the document or the Download icon may appear in the top right corner of the browser window.

steps.title: Click Save (if prompted).
steps.content: Click Save (if prompted). If your browser automatically downloaded your PDF, you can normally find it in your Downloads folder. Using the file manager, you can choose where to save the PDF.

steps.title: Open a document.
steps.content: Open a document. Open the document, file, or web page that you'd like to save in PDF format.

steps.title: Click on File.
steps.content: Click on File . It's in the menu bar at the top-left of your screen.

steps.title: Click on Print….
steps.content: Click on Print… . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Double-click on Microsoft Print To PDF.
steps.content: Double-click on Microsoft Print To PDF . [1] X Trustworthy Source US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau U.S. government agency for protecting consumers in the financial sector Go to source

steps.title: Name the file.
steps.content: Name the file. Do so in the "File Name:" field near the bottom of the dialog box that opens. [2] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019.

steps.title: Select a location in which to save the file.
steps.content: Select a location in which to save the file. [3] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019.

steps.title: Click on Save.
steps.content: Click on Save . It's the lower-right corner of the dialog box. The document will be saved as a PDF file in the location you specified. [4] X Trustworthy Source US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau U.S. government agency for protecting consumers in the financial sector Go to source

steps.title: Open a document.
steps.content: Open a document. Open the document, file, or web page that you'd like to save in PDF format.

steps.title: Click on File.
steps.content: Click on File . It's in the menu bar at the top-left of your screen. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click on Print….
steps.content: Click on Print… . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click on PDF.
steps.content: Click on PDF . It's in the lower-left corner of the print dialog box. A pop-up menu will open. [7] X Research source If you don't see this option, look for and click on Print using system dialog... . Some applications, such as Adobe Acrobat Reader DC, do not support printing to PDF.

steps.title: Click on Save as PDF….
steps.content: Click on Save as PDF… . It's near the top of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Name the file.
steps.content: Name the file. Do so in the "Save As:" field at the top of the dialog box.

steps.title: Select a location.
steps.content: Select a location. Use the drop-down menu below the "Save As:" field or choose a location from the "Favorites" section on the left side of the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on Save.
steps.content: Click on Save . It's the lower-right corner of the dialog box. The document will be saved as a PDF file in the location you specified.

steps.title: Open a Microsoft Word, Excel, or PowerPoint document.
steps.content: Open a Microsoft Word, Excel, or PowerPoint document. This works for both computers and mobile phones and tablets.

steps.title: Click on File.
steps.content: Click on File . It's in the menu bar at the top-left of your screen.

steps.title: Click on Save As….
steps.content: Click on Save As… . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source In some versions of Office, click on Export... if it's an option in the File menu.

steps.title: Click on the File Format: drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click on the File Format: drop-down menu. [9] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click on PDF.
steps.content: Click on PDF . In newer versions of Office, it will be listed in the "Export Formats" section of the menu. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a name for the document in the "Export As:"
steps.content: Enter a name for the document in the "Export As:" field. [11] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019.

steps.title: Select a location in which to save the document.
steps.content: Select a location in which to save the document.

steps.title: Click on Save.
steps.content: Click on Save . It's the lower-right corner of the dialog box. The document will be saved as a PDF file in the location you specified.

steps.title: Press ⌘ Cmd+P (Mac) or Ctrl+P (Windows).
steps.content: Press ⌘ Cmd + P (Mac) or Ctrl + P (Windows). You can also go to the browser's menu and select Print . [12] X Research source If you're using an Android, iPhone, or iPad, you can tap the menu icon for your web browser and then tap Print .

steps.title: Select Save as PDF from the "Destination" drop-down.
steps.content: Select Save as PDF from the "Destination" drop-down. It will be selected by default if you aren't connected to a printer. If you are hooked up to a printer, make sure you change this to save a PDF instead of printing the page. [13] X Research source If you only want to save certain pages, change this drop-down next to "Pages." Use "Custom" if you only want to save specific pages, like 2 and 3. You'll see a preview of how many pages will be included in your PDF in the top right corner of the window. Click More Settings if you want to customize how the PDF saves and what the pages look like.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the bottom right corner of the window. [14] X Research source When your file manager pops up (Finder for Mac and File Explorer for Windows), select where you want to save the file, then click Save .
